subject: Re: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... You may well not need to do this. However if a test changes static data, then you may wish to change it back to its original state before running the next
messageBody:
Robert Wenner wrote:
> On Thursday 26 May 2005 13:13, Elliotte Harold wrote:
>
>>1. If you need to initialize static data before each test.
>
>
> Why static data? You can just write something like
> private static final String myStaticTestData = "...";
> in your test class -- no need for setUp() or the constructor.
> What am I missing here?
>

You may well not need to do this. However if a test changes static data,
then you may wish to change it back to its original state before running
the next test. This applies not just to static data in the test class
but to static data in any other classes the test class refers to.
However, as I said. This is a corner case. It's just one of the only
ones I can think of where you really might need setUp and tearDown.

--
Elliotte Rusty Harold elharo@...
